reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great, unusual touches everywhere, each room is different. We had a room road side - road is very noisy - not good if you are a light sleeper. and after one night upgraded(paid £20 extra per night), to move to a room harbour side- we had requested a quiet room, they gave us road side. After we changed sides- found ourselves next to a noisy boiler room /air con room or something-- obviously need to state more clearly what constitutes quiet!!!!!
reviews.title: iceland break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Breakfast lovely , good mixture.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent service, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff helpful.
reviews.title: Good with a style all of its own

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note Iceland is very expensive to eat/drink out - a 'standard ' bottle of wine - £45-----use the supermarket.
reviews.title: The hotel with an edge.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I are currently staying here for a long weekend. The hotel is very new with modern, quirky design. Rooms are comfortable although it must be noted that the bathroom is separated from the room with frosted glass sliding door. The hotel staff are very helpful, friendly, and always pleased to provide local knowledge, booking restaurants, etc. The bar and restaurant are full on Friday's and Saturday's as this seems to be the place to be seen in Reykjavik. We can thoroughly recommend this hotel and will be visiting again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel; Had A Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Fab hotel, only been open since April 2012. So you can still smell the newness of the place. Hotel was in good location. It had quirky interior which we liked. The bar had a happy hour 4pm - 6pm which was good value. We ate at the Slippbarin & the food was fab. Not a big menu but the quality was there. We had a room overlooking the dock, which was nice and quiet. Staff were ever so helpful, would stay again
reviews.title: Great hotel in best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: This hotel was a prefect base for our stay in reykjavik. We felt at home as soon as we entered the hotel. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. All areas were spotlessly clean. The location is a 5 minute walk from the main shopping area. We will definitely return for another stay in the future.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great hotel overall, close to the centre of Reykjavik and all it's sights and eateries. I loved the funky lobby and bar area which get packed in the evenings with trendy after work drinkers and diners.
reviews.title: Quirky hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was comfortable but personally I did not like the glass sliding door to the bathroom which really provided no privacy as it didn't even seal closed - just pulled across. This might not bother everyone but it bothered me. There were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room which was a pain in the mornings if you like a caffeine shot in bed before getting up and dressed. The bed was very comfortable with the Scandinavian approach of individual duvets on joined single mattresses.
reviews.title: A Hotel with lots of Character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a delicious buffet offering plenty of choice. We never ate dinner in the hotel as we preferred to explore the city. The staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Good, but not quite as good as it could be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights b&b with 2 kids. Booked 6 bedded bunk room for a bit of extra chilling space. Perfect ground floor setting right next to reception so kids cld come and go as they pleased. Beds and bedding are soooo comfy and roomy.
reviews.title: Best choice for short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Families should be aware top bunk is high. Was ok for 13yr but 7 yr struggled a bit and chose take dble bed settee as his instead. Again very comfy and big. Bathroom was fine dunno wot the fuss is about! Sliding deeply frosted door - so what!
reviews.title: Hotel overbooked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast really good, desserts lovely, coffee good, staff friendly and so helpful when it came to trips and sights.
reviews.title: Different, well located, and excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most importance to us was situation - marina was perfect for short trip as in the harbour right on the edge of old town with lots if nice restaurants and cafes just minutes walk away including trip advisor fave hot dog stand - kids fave meal of the trip and cheap!
reviews.title: Quirky but comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely recommend to those who can do quirky - a few traditionalists struggled with the setting 10 ft from working dockyard but we loved it!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Don't be deterred by the fact that from the outside the Marina Hotel looks like a Soviet housing block. Once you walk through the lobby doors, you will find an inviting ambiance that is just quirky enough to make it fun without being over-the-top.
reviews.title: Fun and funky hotel in a great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of the Marina Hotel is without a doubt its common areas. The lobby is a modern industrial design with groupings of colorful furniture and interesting artwork that are a perfect invitation to sit and mingle with friends. They set up a bar at one end in the evening for a cozy happy hour featuring the hotel's signature drinks (I heartily recommend the "Winter Sour"). The bartender, like every other staff member in the hotel, is cheerful, friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Added to the whole Icelandic experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby flows into an open-concept bar and restaurant decorated in the same eclectic style. In spite of the large selection of restaurants in Reykjavik, we decided to eat in the hotel's restaurant one evening because we found the decor so appealing, and we were not disappointed. While the menu offerings were a bit limited, the food was delicious and the service was professional and attentive. We were particularly impressed by the cheerful and knowledgeable way the server accommodated the rather complicated dietary restrictions of two members of our group.
reviews.title: Lovely!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The reception staff were wonderful. Aside from being efficient and friendly during check-in, they recommended local sites, shopping and restaurants, and booked a number of day tours for us. We had come to Iceland on short notice on a last-minute deal, and the front desk essentially served as our travel consultants. We were very impressed that they routinely went the extra mile for us.
reviews.title: Smart hotel. Clean room, comfortable bed,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was well above average for a hotel of this size, and the staff did a superb job of keeping it fresh and well-stocked even at peak times. We had a very early flight on our last morning, which meant missing breakfast. While we were waiting for the bus to the airport, the front desk clerk invited us to "raid" the small food cooler in the lobby (except for beer!). It was really a nice gesture, and typical of the little extras that make the Marina special.
reviews.title: A great hotel
